bibl.title: Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt.
bibl.note: Arsinoe II (ca. 316-270 B.C.) as a royal model. - The struggles of Cleopatra II (ca. 185-116 B.C.) and Cleopatra III (d. 101 B.C.). - The challenge of representing Roman partners. - Cleopatra's emulation of Arsinoe II. - Cleopatra's divine status. - Double or triple uraeus for Cleopatra's crown. - Images of Ptolemaic royal women as queens and goddesses. - Cleopatra as Isis. - Cleopatra as the Roman Isis?
bibl.seg: Ashton Sally-Ann, Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt.
Margaret M. Miles (Ed.), Cleopatra. A Sphinx Revisited (Berkeley, 2011) pp. 21-36, figg. 4-6.

Arsinoe II (ca. 316-270 B.C.) as a royal model. - The struggles of Cleopatra II (ca. 185-116 B.C.) and Cleopatra III (d. 101 B.C.). - The challenge of representing Roman partners. - Cleopatra's emulation of Arsinoe II. - Cleopatra's divine status. - Double or triple uraeus for Cleopatra's crown. - Images of Ptolemaic royal women as queens and goddesses. - Cleopatra as Isis. - Cleopatra as the Roman Isis?
